signify 480370863906-8deqtn8nq63qk01efb5pudici2c805ek.apps.googleusercontent.com Here you can practice your sign language, with feedback through your camera. Make sure to check your daily quest to learn a new letter every day. You’ll also find exercises at the bottom to challenge yourself at varying levels of difficulty. Here, you can change your settings and customize your profile. You’ll also get to add your friends to learn together. You’ll find a recap of your progress in the statistics board. Here you can challenge your friends to sign language face-offs. Graphs and statistics for the challenges
https://nerdish.io/topics/what-you-should-know-about-sign-language/
Practice your ASL hand gestures using the camera and see real-time feedback. You are currently offline. Use the login button to return online.

The cat sits on the mat
Birds fly across the sky
She walks to the park
It rains on summer days
The stars shine at night
Dogs bark in the yard
The sun rises every day
A child plays with toys
Tips: Close your hand, put your thumb to the left, and direct it to the left. Tips: Extend all fingers straight up. Place your thumb across your palm. Fingers are straight and close together. Tips: Fingers and thumb are curved to form a C shape. Tips: Extend your index finger up while touching your thumb to the tip of your middle finger. Other fingers are slightly curved. Tips: Curl your fingers down over your thumb, forming an E shape with the fingertips near the thumb. Tips: Touch the tip of your thumb to the tip of your index finger to form an O shape. The other fingers are extended and spread out. Tips: Hold your thumb and index finger parallel and close to each other, while the other fingers are folded down. Tips: Extend your index and middle fingers, holding them together. Other fingers are curled down. Tips: Raise your pinky finger up, keeping all other fingers down, including the thumb. Tips: Move your pinky finger downwards in a slight curve, as if drawing the letter J in the air. Tips: Extend your index and middle fingers apart, with your thumb touching the middle finger. The other fingers are curled down. Tips: Form an L shape by extending your index finger up and your thumb out to the side, keeping the other fingers curled down. Tips: Tuck your thumb under your index, middle, and ring fingers, with only the pinky finger showing outside. Tips: Tuck your thumb under your index and middle fingers, with the other fingers resting down. Tips: Curve all fingers and the thumb to form an O shape. Tips: Point your index and middle fingers down, keeping them apart, with the thumb supporting them. The other fingers are curled down. Tips: Point your thumb and index finger down in an L shape. The rest of the fingers are curled down. Tips: Cross your index and middle fingers, holding them together, while the other fingers are curled down. Tips: Make a fist with your thumb resting over the other fingers. Tips: Make a fist with your thumb tucked between your index and middle fingers. Tips: Hold your index and middle fingers up and close together, with the other fingers curled down. Tips: Hold your index and middle fingers up and apart in a V shape, with the other fingers curled down. Tips: Hold your index, middle, and ring fingers up, spreading them out, with the other fingers curled down. Tips: Curl your index finger, pointing it up, while the other fingers are folded down. Your thumb rests near the index finger. Tips: Extend your pinky and thumb out to the sides, with the other fingers folded down. Tips: Move your index finger to trace a Z shape in the air.
